books.title: Crucial Conversations
books.author: Patterson, Grenny, McMillan & Switzler
books.note: Learn how to handle high‑stakes, emotionally charged conversations with honesty, respect and skill.

books.title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
books.author: Robert Kiyosaki
books.note: Contrasts two perspectives on money — highlighting how financial education, asset‑building and mindset shape wealth and success.

books.title: Start with Why
books.author: Simon Sinek
books.note: Explains that leaders and organizations succeed by clearly defining and communicating their core purpose ("why") before focusing on the "how" and "what," inspiring loyalty and driving action.

books.title: Atomic Habits
books.author: James Clear
books.note: Revolutionary insights on building good habits and breaking bad ones — this book changed how I approach personal and professional growth.

books.title: Influence: Science and Practice
books.author: Robert Cialdini
books.note: Explores the psychological principles behind why people say "yes" and how to ethically apply them.

books.title: Leaders Eat Last
books.author: Simon Sinek
books.note: Argues that great leaders prioritize the well-being of their team, creating a culture of trust and safety that inspires loyalty, collaboration, and long-term success.

books.title: The Richest Man in Babylon
books.author: George S. Clason
books.note: Shares timeless financial wisdom through parables set in ancient Babylon, emphasizing saving consistently, living below your means and investing wisely.

books.title: Extreme Ownership
books.author: Jocko Willink & Leif Babin
books.note: Leaders must take complete responsibility for everything in their team's performance, owning mistakes and solutions alike to drive success.

books.title: How to Win Friends and Influence People
books.author: Dale Carnegie
books.note: Practical strategies for building strong relationships, gaining trust and influencing others through genuine interest and respectful communication.

books.title: A Trusted Advisor
books.author: Robert M. Galford
books.note: Explores how professionals can build deep client relationships by earning trust through credibility, reliability and empathy.

books.title: Mindset
books.author: Carol S. Dweck
books.note: The power of believing you can improve — this book shaped my approach to learning and facing challenges in tech.

books.title: Moonwalking with Einstein
books.author: Joshua Foer
books.note: Follows a journalist's journey into the world of competitive memory, revealing how ancient mnemonic techniques can improve cognitive performance.

books.title: Think and Grow Rich
books.author: Napoleon Hill
books.note: Distills the principles of success into a mindset of desire, faith, persistence and clarity of purpose to turn thoughts into achievement.

books.title: User Stories Applied
books.author: Mike Cohn
books.note: Explains how to write effective user stories in agile development, enhancing communication and ensuring software delivers real value to users.
